pages.text: This "crying obsidian" material captures my imagination. So far, the "tears" it creates have soaked into other materials in a matter of seconds.$(br2)...if only enough of it can be collected for a detailed study.
Perhaps... trying to hold it in a noble metal?
Somehow this doesn't sound completely unreasonable. And it's not hard to check anyway.$(br2)All that's required is to find a few silver bars, forge a crucible and hang some obsidian over it.

pages.name: Tear Collection
pages.text: The gap between the crying obsidian and the crucible can be increased.

If silver will actually be able to contain tears, it opens so many possibilities for experiments on this... "material"...$(br2)Random rocks were able to absorb separate tears without any noticeable change, but could they do the same if completely sumberged? Unlikely.
